item.title: Report X-2023081090
item.description:
Report X-2023081090

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-14T03:11:45+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-04
  • City: LOS ANGELES
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: When package was being unloaded from the trailer, it was wet so package was sent to QA for inspection by management. When inspected, two bottles inside package was found with loose caps causing leakage. DescribePack: Loose cap on plastic bottle was the cause of the leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed inside a plastic tote by management to contain the leakage.

item.title: Report E-2023090147
item.description:
Report E-2023090147

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-13T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-25
  • City: SAN LORENZO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 25, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon pail of isopropanol alcohol (UN1219) was punctured by a forklift and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Ancon Services (AS) to remediate the impacted site. AS personnel deployed absorbents to the impacted dock and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents and the damaged container of product were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum and one (1) 15-gallon drum to be staged onsite for disposal by R+L.

item.title: Report E-2023090121
item.description:
Report E-2023090121

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-13T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-25
  • City: OAKLAND
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 25, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of bioside was damaged and released approximately its full contents to the trailer interior and pavement beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Ancon to remediate the impacted site. Ancon personnel deployed granular absorbents, absorbent pads, and utilized a pressure washer to the bioside-impacted roadway, trailer interior/exterior and freight. All spent absorbents, absorbent pads and damaged drum were collected and containerized into three (3) 55-gallon drums and one (1) 95-gallon over-pack for terminal disposal.

  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that the one case of epoxy (un1263) had been crushed by other freight and that one of the inner metal on gallon can had released 1 cup of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

item.title: Report E-2023090083
item.description:
Report E-2023090083

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-13T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-15
  • City: RICHMOND
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: An employee was offloading a trailer at Veolia's 10 day intransit facility in Richmond, CA and was staging the drums outside of the trailer prior to receiving the drums to the designated location. He was utilizing a forklift in which he was approaching 4 drums that were palletized. The employee did not realize that the pallet was not a standard size pallet and was not as deep. The forks exceeded the length of the pallet and hit the drum that was on the opposing side. The forks hit the drum roughly an inch above the bottom chime resulting in the drum getting damaged and a small pinhole leak occurred. The overall duration of the incident was a less than 10 minutes and it was determined that approximately 4 to 5 cups of material leaked out. The Veolia employees on site were able to contain the spill and place the damaged drum into a salvage drum.

  • Description: On July 26th a package containing UN1760, Corrosive Liquid, n.o.s. (trimethylopropane triglcidylether), 8, III. The package had a small leak and it is unknown how the package developed the leak. The spill was cleaned and the package was placed into a salvage drum. an amended shippers declaration has been requested.

item.title: Report X-2023070473
item.description:
Report X-2023070473

  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A fiberboard box was discovered with signs of release at the ONTR facility. While investigating the fiberboard box the spill agent discovered that one of the plastic bottles inside had spilled its contents inside of the fiberboard box. The bottles were packaged with bubble wrap. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and the shipper was contacted for an amended declaration for movement.

item.title: Report X-2023061322
item.description:
Report X-2023061322

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-16T00:32:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-21
  • City: STOCKTON
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF Railway Company
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 2023 06 21 this HAZMAT shipment was observed leaking during deramping at that Stockton Intermodal Facility. Unit was placed in the hazpit for safekeeping until remediation was complete. Hazmat One was notified and they dispatched Patriot Environmental to inspect and remediate. Contractor arrived on property at approximately 13:00 to begin remediation. Upon exterior inspection, contractor observed a liquid, with a strong odor leaking at a rate of 4 5 drops per minute from the rear right corner of the trailer. Leaking liquid appears to be evaporating shortly after hitting the ground. Once door was opened, contractor observed a shipment of mixed freight, which included two pallets of metal drums loaded at the rear. Both pallets shifted toward the door, coming to rest against a load bar, which caused damage to four drums (two of which are leaking and identified in attached photos). It is estimated that a total of 2 quarts of product leaked from two drums. Product is identified as UN1247 // METHYL METHACRYLATE MONOMER, STABILIZED.

item.title: Report X-2023060815

  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF Railway Company
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: GBRX 702552 identified with release from top of car. BNSF Mechanical responders identified and secured 3 of 8 man way swing bolts to secure the release. The gasket was inspected for integrity and was found to be in a serviceable condition.
